text: Fred Kida (December 12, 1920 - April 3, 2014) was a Japanese-American comic book and comic strip artist. He was best known for the 1940s aviator hero Airboy and his antagonist and sometime ally Valkyrie during the Golden Age of Comic Books. He was born in Brooklyn, New York City, New York. Kida died from natural causes on April 3, 2014, aged 93. ==References== ==Other websites== * Fred Kida at The Comic Book Database Category:1920 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American cartoonists Category:American comics artists Category:People from New York City
title: Fred Kida
